reviews.sentence: Excellent hotel in a good location and very reasonably priced for NYC. Good room size very good staff.
Wonderful. Very friendly staff facility fine rooms comfortable. Relatively decent price for NYC.

Convenient Clean and inexpensive. Convenient clean and inexpensive hotel in midtown Manhattan. The staff was friendly the room was clean and the price was under 200 per night. Hard to ask for more than that in Manhattan in this day and age.

Good location and value for price but not 4 stars. I stayed at this hotel for two nights with friends. We enjoyed the free wine happy hour the hotel offers from 5 6 every day the size of our room very large by NYC standards although we did have a suite the location and the overall value for the price. However the service really left something to be desired we spent a lot of time waiting around for the staff to help us at the front desk because they were chatting amongst themselves and the room was not terribly clean or well maintained. I found a Sour Patch kid in the middle of the floor of our room. Also there was no shower curtain or door so the whole bathroom gets wet when you take a shower. why do hotels do that.

Spacious room with great view for a great price. The staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. My room was clean and spacious. I had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building from the balcony of my room. I had definitely want to stay here again. Also loved that you have the option to stow your luggage free of charge after you check out. We were able to see more of the city and hang out longer after we checked out. There is no self park option. The hotel has only valet parking services at 55 a day. Also after every 24 hours the price goes up. So for example if you parked your car for 36 hours you will be charged for 2 full days paying 110. That was slightly inconvenient not to have an hourly rate option.

Great friendly centralized hotel. Had a great stay at this hotel. Booked a room with a small kitchenette so we could make fresh tea and coffee the room was huge with two queen beds which were very comfy and made sleeping to real pleasure after hard days sightseeing. They had a fantastic rooftop terrace where you could see the Chrysler building one way and Empire state building the other way so a great central location couple blocks from Macys and 1520 mins walk to Times square. It was a fairly quiet area which we wanted itself a rarity in New York but close enough to all the buzz if you want. There was a great little diner across the road called Scotys which did great breakfast lunch and dinner at affordable prices. It was also friendly and quite interesting to see the comings and goings there many locals used it. First trip to Ny and if we were to be able to return we would go to the Shelburn again.

Solid well priced hotel in Murray Hill. Spent the weekend at his hotel. Check in was brisk and front desk service was friendly and efficient. The room on the second floor was large two queen beds and comfortable with a little kitchenette. Large bathroom. The location is terrific near Grand Central Empire State etc. Really just slept and showered there on this trip so I can not comment about food or any other amenities. One negative. they charge for wi fi.

Beautiful hotel with a reasonable price. Loved my stay at the Shelburne. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. Room was roomy HUGE and comfortable. Only negative is that it is not closer to the subway. Would highly recommend the Shelburne.

Far better than expected. This Hotel is excellently positioned near Empire State Central Station Chrystler Building many eateries nearby and very reasonably priced. Good sized rooms very clean excellent power shower good towels very comfy beds and very large too. Very clean. Coffee tea making machine in room. Good lighting in room safe for valuables nice and clean room throughout. Can not fault their staff and I mean ALL of them. Very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. FREE WINE 5 6 pm every evening in lounge area quite unexpected. I would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel it was everything we hoped it would be. The Manager of this Hotel deserves praise indeed for such brilliant kind and attentive staff. Exceeded all expectationsI am very quick to complain if there is a problem and believe me I could not find fault anywhere our family of 6 staying in 3 rooms were all delighted. I hope this review helps you choose to stay here I know you will be happy to give them praise too afterwards. Last word ENJOY. And of course have a nice stay day.

Great hotel huge room very reasonable price. We just spent our 20th wedding anniversary weekend at the Afinia Hotel and had a great stay. They delivered a complimentary bottle of wine to our room as an anniversary present which I thought was a very nice touch. That and the free wine hour every day in the lobby helped make this a relaxing weekend. Not to forget Andy at the front desk was great and very accommodating.

Home Away From Home. I am a New Yorker that lives in London now and I have been staying at the Shelburne for almost 20 years. It was an apartment hotel when I first stayed there offering a kitchenette in many of its room. they have modernized in recent years and that is no longer available. Although some of the suites have a kitchen area with microwave small fridge kettle crockery and cutlery which is great if you are there for a long stay. The hotel is very trendy now with nice decor in the rooms. Beds are big and comfortable with choice of pillow type. All rooms have a small fridge. Bathrooms are nice and clean and prettier than they used to be. The only thing I wish they had not changed was the small toiletries they offered. They were good quality but now they have pump dispensers in the showers which are not as good. Any issues with your room are resolved asap. The employees are extremely friendly and helpful and there is pretty much nothing they would not do to make you feel at home. Some of the employees have been there for as long as I have been going there. I think that speaks volumes for the management. Room service is good. The Shelburne has a great burger restaurant called RARE on site and have an amazing outdoor bar lounge on the roof which is very popular especially with young city professionals. there is a small gym that is got most of what you need for a decent workout during your stay. Running machines stair masters bikes weights mats water towels and TV. Another criticism is that I have not been happy in the last few years that they charge for wifi daily. Movies are also expensive but I think that is the same in many of the better hotels. it is not an inexpensive hotel although you can get some pretty good deals at various times during the year. The location is Murray Hill which is a great neighborhood. Safe full of restaurants bars shops and close to a major subway stop Grand Central. you are a hop skip and a jump from many of the places you had like to visit. it is pretty central without being an overly busy area. I would still choose to stay here when in NYC than anywhere else.

Dismissive staff make for a forgetable stay if only they were not still overcharging me. Nothing really as it continues to be a headache having stayed here. Though granted I arrived quite late checking in around 2 am that does not justify the empty lobby and staff less front desk that I encountered. Nor would it justify the I will be right there just wait that was shouted from some unknown inner sanctity that I was not privy to. Then issue finding the reservation. Ah got it but they did not put the price of the room on it. I gave him the information and he proceeded to add taxes and add ons already included in the price which I pointed out. They never show the full price I have been handling reservations from them for years. So I pulled up the confirmation on my phone and let him read for himself that all was included. Nonetheless he did some odd math and put in a price that was not the actual price. And days later when I checked my credit card statement to find a still higher price I called and spoke to another person at the front desk who stumbled around awkward explanations and phantom reservation confirmations only to have him abruptly end the call announcing he had found the information and would credit my account for the overcharge. And I did receive a nominal credit again that has nothing to do with reality which I will follow up on after finishing this review.

Location location location. The hotel is well placed for walking to Grand Central 5 10 mins the subway 5 10 mins Time Square 5 10 mins etc. Staff are definitely pleasant and helpful. Rooms are definitely spacious and well appointed but are looking a little tired. Obviously fixtures fittings walls doors etc get battered every day by guests who have no respect but there could be an opportunity for a paint job coming up. Cleanliness in our room was definitely an issue. Bathroom door had to be cleaned by me as it looked like excrement andor some juice was all over the interior. These are the fine points which differentiates one hotel from another attention to detail. This includes making sure the clock is set to the current time which I did myself having found the adjustment on the back making sure the lights all work not taking towels for cleaning which are not left on the floor environmental responsibility card in the bathroom stipulates this cleaning the fridge etc. Those guests with an eye for detail will pick up on this. Sadly the most disappointing part of our stay is the outdated archaic practice of charging the 25tax resort fee. Seriously this has to stop. it is 2017. Levying a charge for wi fi and the gym is like levying a charge for electricity. As for providing a 10 credit for snacks drinks it is absurd and frankly insulting to human intelligence to charge such OUTRAGEOUS prices. This practice should be illegal and most of the reviews for the hotel mention this as a negative point. It would be preferable to abandon the free wine hour in favor of removing this resort fee. If you truly think you are a resort then provide water fountains with recyclable cups which would elevate your reputation for not taking advantage of your guests by charging 25tax and offering a bottle of water for 10. Really this is a practice out of the dark ages. Your management needs to wake up and take note. it is 2017. If your guests continue to be gullible and think 25 represents value for money lucky for you but bad karma for taking advantage.

Walking distance to everything but still quiet so you can sleep. The room was large and comfortable. It was also remarkably quiet as it was on a busy street we were lucky enough to have a room at the back of the hotel. The location was great only a short walk from Grand Central Station and we could see both the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building from the entrance. Our room had a small kitchenette with a fridge which meant we could buy milk and keep our drinks coldthere is only a coffee machine no kettle if you want tea. There are a lot of taxes and extra charges including a 25 a night service charge which really add up so make sure you take this into account when deciding if it is within your budget. They have an odd service where you get 10 a day as part of the service charge to spend at their shop which is just a small selection of overpriced snacks and drinks. a bottle of water uses up your entire allowance. And they are very strict if you try and use it just after midnight. Would rather just not have to pay this money in the first place.

Great location. We stayed here for 6 nights and had booked a one bedroom suite. We had an issue with a broken sofa bed on check in miscomunications between hotel staff and a disturbed first night had to change rooms the following day but manager dealt with situation ultimately to our satisfaction. Really liked the location would have hated staying in a busier locality. Took train from Newark to Penn and easy 25 minute walk to Lexington Avenue. Would recommend East River Ferry a couple of blocks away as an option to Subway which we did not take as we do not overly like. Same price as Subway. Loads of eating options up near Grand Central which is 5 minute walk. Room clean and spacious with a few scuffs on furniture and 2 of the bed reading lamps did not work but minor issues and would not stop me recommending.

Not a 4star hotel but that is ok. The hotel is fine but is described as fantastic and four star. Is is neither of these things but I did not expect them for what I paid. The hotel feels like it is trying hard to be four star but it does not need to. The rooms could be updated a bit but were basically just fine. The staff were very friendly.

Great experience. Our family of four two teens visited NYC for a Knicks game. We stayed at the Shelburne NYC Saturday night. We used valet for our car 70 dollars for 24 hours. The staff of the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The desk clerk quickly checked us in the bell man brought us up to our room with luggage and was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was great and wait staff were very nice. This a great location and a great price. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. I would not hesitate to stay here again. Great job staff of the Shelburne they all deserve a bonus. Check out the rooftop a great view of the Empire State Building.

We are long time Afinia guests having mostly stayed at the Dumont in recent years. We are very happy that Su Mui from the Dumont is now at the Shelburne and she has been very kind and helpful. We were also delighted that Karen Medina is now back with Afinia and it was so nice to see her unexpectedly at the front desk the evening we checked in. Our room was quite good size and the bathroom was nice. The air conditioning system did not work very well and it seems like these need to be updated. One thing that constantly bothers us is the facilities fee. To a large extent we really do not drink and we are generally working or otherwise busy and would not attend the wine reception. We do not generally use the gym. And we do not really need wifi. This essentially means the 40 with tax. we is going to a 10 pantry credit which one can use to get a bottle of water that might normally be 2. I strongly encourage you to find a different paradigm in this regard. Although we really like the Afinia chain and some of the staff a great deal we have no particular interest in subsidizing other peoples wine reception etc. Part of what is bothersome is that the way it is done seems disingenuous. We would rather see the room be 40 more up front when looking at pricing than to see a low rate and then be reminded that it is really plus 40 per night for items that might appeal to some people but not to us. Perhaps you could give people the option of attending the wine reception using the gym using wifi and getting a 10 pantry credit in a package for 20 or 30 and simply charge an extra 10 or 20 across the board. Personally speaking we would rather have a room price 20 higher with the option of paying an extra 20 for the facilities package which we would not do than to pay 40 so other people can have wine and other things we do not want. Thanks for your consideration of this matter. On the whole we really like the hotel and Su and Karen do a great job.

They add a facility fee so the nightly fee is actually 35 higher than the listed price. You are expected to know that this entitles you to use 10 at their food counter where everything is priced x5 higher than in the store down the street. do not forget to pick up your 10 bottle of water. I felt nickeled and dimed and left feeling bad about paying their price.
Seems all nyc hotels add a local 40 dollars a day so Expedia discounted price is not what it seems.
